parse.title: The Lord of the Rings Index

links.*: The Lord of the Rings: A Reader's Companion
The Lord of the Rings Foreword

wikitext.*:
{{stub}}
The '''Index''' was first published in the Ballantine Books edition of ''[[The Lord of the Rings]]'' in 1965. This index was a revision of an index that was compiled by [[Nancy Smith]] in [[1958]] based on the requirements of [[J.R.R. Tolkien]] for "an alphabetical list of all proper names of persons, places, or things .. in the ''text'' (including Foreword and Prologue, but ''not'' the Appendices)". It was combined with an index of songs and verses that was compiled by [[Baillie Klass]].<ref name=Index>{{HM|RC}}, p. lxxxii</ref>

[[J.R.R. Tolkien]] added some notes and 'translations' and selected citations to the appendices to the index for the Allen & Unwin second edition of [[1966]].<ref name=Index/>

In [[2005]] a new, enlarged index<ref name=Index/> was compiled by [[Wayne G. Hammond]] and [[Christina Scull]] independent of the previous index, but J.R.R. Tolkien's added notes and translations were retained within square brackets.<ref>{{RK|Index}}, Introduction</ref>

==Contents of previous editions==
*I Songs and Verses
**(a) [''Titles'']
**(b) ''First Lines''
*II Persons, Beasts and Monsters
*III Places
*IV Things

==Contents of the 2005 edition==
*(Foreword)
*I. Poems and Songs
*II. Poems and Phrases in Languages Other Than Common Speeech
*III. Persons, Places, and Things

==See also==
*"[[Unfinished index]]" (manuscript)
*[[Letter to Oscar Morland]] (letter)
